Name: HMS Pakenham
Fate: Scuttled off Sicily after surface action on 16 April 1943
Displacement:
1,690 long tons (1,720 t) standard
2,250 long tons (2,290 t) full load
Range: 3,850 nmi (7,130 km; 4,430 mi) at 20 knots (37 km/h; 23 mph)
Armament:
5 × single QF 4 in Mk.V (102 mm) guns
1 × quadruple QF 2-pdr Mk.VIII AA guns
Up to 6 × single QF 20 mm Oerlikon AA guns
1 × quadruple 21-inch torpedo tubes
4 × throwers and 2 × racks for 70 depth charges
